intro: Trichonema dichotomum, commonly known as the dichotomous moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its finely branched, often dichotomously branching stems that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually small, elongated, and have a distinct midrib. Trichonema dichotomum plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat.
